Posts.Content: Aug 4, 2018 05:16PM NervousNellie18 wrote: Hi Trixy09, I am in the same boat worrying about a spot on my breast. I too am having off and on pain and a little extra soreness on my right breast. I have had flat pinkish/purplish spot on my breast for almost 5 months. The surgeon thought it was hormones from nursing, I have quit nursing and it's still there. He now thinks it's vascular but he did a skin biopsy, I should find out results next week....3 weeks later....Just wanted to say you're not alone. Google has terrified me as well. Hang in there.

Posts.Content: Apr 26, 2017 04:01PM nervousnelly456 wrote: Chief Complaint: ABNORMAL MAMMOGRAM INDICATION: Abnormal Mammogram. Questionable calcifications in the right breast. EXAMINATION: Unilateral RIGHT additional digital views were performed to supplement the screening mammogram from April 10 2017. FINDINGS: There is a new group of calcifications in the right breast at 12-1 oclock posterior depth. The calcifications span approximately 5 mm. IMPRESSION: New calcifications in the superior right breast. Surgical consultation and stereotactic guided biopsy are recommended. The findings and recommendations were discussed with the patient following the exam. BI-RADS 4: SUSPICIOUS ABNORMALITY-TISSUE DIAGNOSIS IS SUGGESTED
